instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message:
[SIZE=3]green light= yes
pp3v42 good/normal[/SIZE]

[SIZE=3]ppbus_g3h good/normal [/SIZE]

[SIZE=3]pp3v3_s5 good/normal [/SIZE]

[SIZE=3]pp5v5 good [/SIZE]

[SIZE=3]ppv3v3_s3 NOTHING HERE (ENABLE IS 3.3V On mosfet, but its a P mosfet, idk if that means the voltage should be lower than the output,) [/SIZE]
(ARE S3 LINES SUPPOSED TO SHOW BEFORE THE DEVICE POWERS UP?)
[SIZE=3]no ppvp_fw (idk when this is supposed to show)
original problem, no power, 3 burnt components on audio jack line (replaced them) ran a jumper on that line as well.

help please :) [/SIZE]

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message: good/normal is not a measurement. Are you using a REAL 85W charger? This will not power on from 60W and Chinese garbage.

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message: my bads im new to posting, ill add measurements, the charger is original, and i have several to choose from which all appear original.

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message: I measured smc_adapter_en on R5085, and i get 3.4v

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message:
Check 5V_S3 bus if there are pulses. Multimeter are too slow to catch so best to use a scope. Check all rails for short to GND.
Does the battery charge?

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message: i dont currently own a scope, if you have a recommendation for a cheap but good one please let me know. Idk if the battery charges or not so I will check that as well. Thank you for your help, I realize when someone is new its a bit frustrating to help them, so again thank you.

threads.title: 820-2850-A no power, green light yes, power rails good
threads.message: No need for 150MHz. A 20MHz scope will do too, you can pick them up for free everywhere.
